data.event: The town was formed in 1831 from the Town of Hornby.
Former New York State Route 333, now County Road 333, enters the town from the west.
This portion of track was built opened in 1882 as the New York (Hoboken) to Buffalo line of the Delaware, Lackawanna & Western Railroad.

event.title: 1963 the route to Buffalo was severed

data.event: In 1963 the route to Buffalo was severed between Wayland and Groveland, N.Y., by order of the U. S. Interstate Commerce Commission in order to promote highway transportation.
